name: Lalibela
description: Experience the spiritual heart of Ethiopia. Marvel at the 11 medieval monolithic cave churches of this 12th-century 'New Jerusalem'. A UNESCO World Heritage site that defies architectural logic.

name: Simien Mountains
description: Trek through the 'Roof of Africa'. Witness dramatic jagged peaks, deep valleys, and unique wildlife like the Gelada baboon and Walia ibex in this breathtaking national park.

name: Addis Ababa
description: Dive into the diplomatic capital of Africa. Explore the National Museum, shop at the vast Merkato, and enjoy the vibrant jazz scene and coffee culture of this bustling metropolis.

name: Axum
description: Walk among the ruins of the ancient Aksumite Empire. See the giant obelisks, the Queen of Sheba's bath, and the chapel believed to house the Ark of the Covenant.

name: Danakil Depression
description: Venture into one of the hottest and lowest places on Earth. Witness the alien landscapes of sulfur springs, salt flats, and the bubbling lava lake of Erta Ale volcano.

name: Gondar
description: Step back in time to the 'Camelot of Africa'. Explore the Royal Enclosure (Fasil Ghebbi) with its fairytale castles and the stunning Debre Berhan Selassie church.

name: Bale Mountains
description: A high-altitude plateau with dramatic escarpments, home to the endangered Ethiopian wolf and mountain nyala. A paradise for trekkers and wildlife enthusiasts.

name: Harar Jugol
description: The fourth holiest city in Islam, known for its 82 mosques, 102 shrines, and unique townhouses with exceptional interior design. Famous for the nightly hyena feeding ritual.

name: Omo Valley
description: Home to some of Africa's most fascinating traditional tribes. A cultural mosaic of diverse ethnic groups maintaining their ancient customs and way of life.

name: Bahir Dar & Lake Tana
description: Source of the Blue Nile and home to island monasteries dating back to the 14th century. The nearby Blue Nile Falls (Tis Abay) is a spectacular sight.

name: Sof Omar Caves
description: One of the most spectacular and extensive underground cave systems in the world. Carved by the Weyib River, it is a place of mystery and natural beauty.

name: Tiya
description: An archaeological site containing 36 monuments, including 32 carved stelae covered with symbols. A UNESCO World Heritage Site offering a glimpse into ancient Ethiopian culture.

name: Awash National Park
description: Ethiopia's oldest national park, featuring the spectacular Awash River gorge, waterfalls, and diverse wildlife including oryx, gazelles, and over 450 bird species.

name: Wenchi Crater Lake
description: A breathtaking crater lake located in an extinct volcano. Visitors can hike, ride horses, or take a boat trip to the island monastery.

name: Nechisar National Park
description: Located between Lakes Abaya and Chamo, this park is famous for its 'Bridge of God' isthmus and diverse wildlife, including the endemic Swayne's hartebeest.
